pullRequest.body:
Define the type of subgraph isomorphisms `SubgraphIso` as the subtype of injective homomorphisms.

Also define

- the predicate that a simple graph contains another simple graph `IsIsoSubgraph`,
- the predicate that a simple graph is free of another simple graph `Free` for convenience.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

`+ isIsoSubgraph_iff_of_iso`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@kbuzzard I've been waiting for others' input on the name `SubgraphIso`. Feel free to weigh in. üòÅ

I think having this (type-valued) definition is valuable, but I find the name pretty confusing here. To me, this is the type of non-induced copies of A inside B, rather than isomorphisms between A and a subgraph of B. As such, I'd prefer `Copy` or something here. But I'd also like others' input on the name
As an extension, I'm also not convinced that `‚â≤g` is helpful notation here: it looks too much like a prop-valued thing rather than data...

> I think having this (type-valued) definition is valuable, but I find the name pretty confusing here. To me, this is the type of non-induced copies of A inside B, rather than isomorphisms between A and a subgraph of B. As such, I'd prefer `Copy` or something here. But I'd also like others' input on the name

There doesn't seem to be a consistent name for injective graph homomorphisms. I've seen "graph embedding", "graph monomorphism", and "subgraph isomorphism". The first is taken. The second is common to category theory. [The third is used by Wolfram.](https://www.wolframalpha.com/input?i=FindSubgraphIsomorphism) (The third is also used by GPT-4o mini when asked about the subgraph isomorphism decision problem, not that it should be any authority on the topic.)
Inspired by some code @YaelDillies shared with me, `LabelledCopy` might also be an option.

I picked `IsIsoSubgraph` first, as `A.IsIsoSubgraph B` reads like "A is isomorphic to a subgraph of B". I picked `SubgraphIso` second, as `IsIsoSubgraph (A) (B) := Nonempty (SubgraphIso A B)`  reads like "A is isomorphic to a subgraph of B" := "the type of subgraph isomorphisms from A to B is nonempty" and that is often how the decision problem is phrased.

> As an extension, I'm also not convinced that `‚â≤g` is helpful notation here: it looks too much like a prop-valued thing rather than data...

I'll drop this in the same commit as the rename.
I think `Copy` is a good name, yes. Mind renaming?
I'll resolve this in the commit dropping `‚â≤g`.

```suggestion
/-- The relation `IsIsoSubgraph A B` says that a simple graph `B` contains a copy of a simple graph `A`. -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): define SubgraphIso
